definition: weak/feeble/young/inferior/(following a decimal or fraction) slightly less than
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"

sentences.english: Ill health seems to have cleared Sarah out.
sentences.chinese: 看來體弱多病已經把薩拉弄得不名一文。

sentences.english: But a nephew of the sickly leader is also a nominee.
sentences.chinese: 但一個領導人的體弱多病的侄子也被提名。

sentences.english: We were sick, but now our blood pressures have gone down," a member said.
sentences.chinese: 我們以前都體弱多病，現在血壓都降低了。

sentences.english: Thouht of the thin body, grandma undertakes all the housework.
sentences.chinese: 雖然祖母體弱多病，她卻承擔起了家裏的所有家務。

sentences.english: His father was a sickly man and his mother washed clothing for a living.
sentences.chinese: 他的父親體弱多病，而母親則靠洗衣服維持家計。

definition: yellow face, emaciated body (idiom); malnourished and sickly in appearance
Long Xing Quan - "Dragon Fist" - Martial Art
full of youthful vigor (idiom)/in the prime of youth
to take refuge in religious life
seriously ill and about to die
adopted daughter (traditional adoption, i.e. without legal ramifications)
